configure.p: The XYPlotter actor plots (x,y) points and displays the graph. The actor reads x and y double tokens via its two input multiports. Each time the actor iterates, it reads one token from each input channel.

X and Y tokens received on the first channel of the input port are plotted together, as are the tokens received on the second channels, etc. The two input port must have the same width (i.e., the same number of input channels).

property.name: port:inputY
property.configure: A multiport that accepts doubles representing y-values. The port must have the same width (i.e., number of input channels) as the inputX port.

property.name: port:inputX
property.configure: A multiport that accepts one or more doubles representing x-values. The port must have the same width (i.e., number of input channels) as the inputY port.

property.name: prop:fillOnWrapup
property.configure: Specify whether to rescale the plot so that all data is visible. By default, the actor scales the plot to fill the display area.

property.name: prop:startingDataset
property.configure: The starting dataset number to which data is plotted. The value must be a non-negative integer. The default is 0.

property.name: prop:legend
property.configure: Annotations that will be displayed with the plot graph. Specify a comma-separated list of values that correspond to the input data sets (e.g., rainfall, temperature, elevation).
